Based on the error message this is the result of Duplicate Rules detecting a conflict between the Lead you're attempting to create and an existing record.

You can check the exact details either via the [Apex Debug logs][1] for the transaction or the [Duplicate Error Logs][2]. Another alternative is to [upsert the lead][3]. You might still run into duplicate rules but if the record matches and the update (rather than insert) happens, the likelihood of duplication is lower.

items.body_markdown:
I am getting resources exceeded issues trying to dedup a large events table and select the most 'recent' event which has the lastest party entity data.  Is there a more efficient way using Arrays (e.g agg by partyId and doe some array magic?) that can help overcome this issue by being more efficient?

The 'latest' party entity data (party data is part of each each event row) is within the NEWEST event row for that party.  i.e greatest EventOccurredTimestamp.  We can also have duplicates events but partitioning and ordering by PartyId would sort that anyway.  Key thing is to get the latest party data from newest event.

Ive tried a usual SQL pattern of 

ROW_NUMBER OVER() PARTITION BY PartyId ORDER BY EventOccurredTimestamp DESC

then take rowNumber = 1, which has worked before nicely, but appears now with a large dataset we are exceeding our resources during execution (we use on demand billing ) and needs to be more efficient,

Some numbers from the source table - 32,304,942 events across all parties (really wide dataset) - 2,946,048 unique partyIds to sort events by EventOccurredTimestamp.

BQ complains about the OVER() cause of course due to the shuffling that happens for sorting.

I think theres a better way to do this using Arrays but needs some input from the community experts to tune it right.

```
#standardSQL
WITH
  party_latest_refdata AS (
  SELECT
    EventId,
    PartyId,
    EventOccurredTimestamp,
    .....
  FROM
    `table`

  ),
  
  -- 32,304,942 events across all parties, 2,946,048 unique partyIds
  party_latest_refdata_partitioned AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY PartyId ORDER BY EventOccurredTimestamp DESC) AS rowNum
  FROM
    party_latest_refdata ),

  -- select row 1, the 'newest' / 'latest'
  deduped_party_latest_refdata AS (
  SELECT
    * EXCEPT(rowNum)
  FROM
    party_latest_refdata_partitioned
  WHERE
    rowNum = 1 )

-- final projection of the latest, deduped party
SELECT
  *
FROM
  deduped_party_latest_refdata
```

Only return the row for the parties newest event.  using the numbers above, that would return 2,946,048 rows - 1 for each party - that have the newest EventOccurredTimestamp
items.title: Efficient Sorting using Arrays

answers.body_markdown:
MySQL is a multithreaded service. If it’s processing several queries at a time, consuming more than one CPU core (which is shown as more than 100% in CPU column of top), then more than one second is added in TIME+ column for this one second of physical time.

You may monitor which threads are currently running within compound MySQL process by issuing

    SHOW PROCESSLIST;

in mysql console (i.e. where you usually issue SQL statements to this server).


**Addition:**

I have a low throughput MySQL 5.6 instance that hasn't been restarted since Jan. 4, 2018. It's runs on debian, bare-metal ARM, it doesn't usually have many idle connections hanging (I see two right now). It has consumed about 2225 minutes of CPU time since then:

    $ ps -eo pid,lstart,time,cmd | grep mysql
     3895 Thu Jan  4 23:09:11 2018 1-13:04:45 /usr/sbin/mysqld ...

I also just took two polls and it added 15 seconds of CPU time in 140 minutes of physical time:

    $ date; ps aux | grep mysql
    Tue Oct  1 16:37:16 UTC 2019
    mysql     3895  0.2 10.7 439512 223352 ?       Sl    2018 2224:37 /usr/sbin/mysqld
    
    $ date; ps aux | grep mysql
    Tue Oct  1 18:57:50 UTC 2019
    mysql     3895  0.2 10.7 439512 223352 ?       Sl    2018 2224:55 /usr/sbin/mysqld

Therefore, at least for that instance it's not normal to add TIME+ metric without actual work performed.

I suspect it's maybe possible that TIME+ would increase without correspondent %CPU in virtual environments, but then you would still need to monitor PROCESSLIST and maybe SHOW ENGINE INNODB STATUS to catch what is consuming CPU cycles in this case.
answers.title: IS MySQL CPU time meant to be so long?

answers.body_markdown:
Indeed the `scope` selector that you're using is not correct here; the `scope` of C++ files is `source.c++` and not `source.cpp`. You can use `Tools > Developer > Show Scope Name` from the menu (or the associated key) while you're editing a file to see the full scope at the current cursor location. For a build system the first line in the scope popup is the one you want to use.

There's another issue with your build (which you have alluded to in the comments) that the build doesn't work as expected. The reason for that is that you're using `cmd` to execute your build, but you're use shell constructs (the `&&`).

When you specify `cmd` in a build system, you provide a list of strings; the first item is the name of the program that you want to execute (here it's `clang++`), and the remaining items are arguments to be given to the program being executed.

So in this case, you're asking Sublime to execute `clang++` directly, and one of the arguments that you're providing to it is `&&`, which it assumes is the name of a file. The intention is to try and run the program if it successfully compiles, but using `&&` is a function of your shell (e.g. `bash` or the like) and not of `clang`.

You can try adding `"shell": true` to your build, which tells Sublime that it should try to execute `cmd` through the system shell instead; that passes everything as a whole to the shell, which does know how to handle `&&`.

The other alternative is to use `shell_cmd` instead; in that case you provide a single string that represents the command line that you would enter into the terminal. In this case when you execute the build, Sublime automatically passes the value to the shell for execution.

In your case, that might look like:

```json
"shell_cmd": "clang++ -o \"${file_base_name}.out\" \"$file\" && \"./${file_base_name}.out\"",
```

Apart from the value being a single string, it's also important to note that if your filenames can potentially contain spaces, you need to wrap all filename arguments in double quotes so that the shell handles things properly.
answers.title: Custom Build System not displayed when set to Automatic

You can delete the log-group, select log-group -> action -> delete

But why you are not stopping the agent itself?


> At a command prompt, type the following command:

> ```sudo service awslogs stop```

> If you are running Amazon Linux 2, type the  following command:
> 
> ```sudo service awslogsd stop ```

[StopTheCWLAgent][1]


Or if you want to delete all log-group then
```
aws logs describe-log-groups --query 'logGroups[*].logGroupName' --output table | awk '{print $2}' | grep -v ^$ | while read x; do aws logs delete-log-group --log-group-name $x; done
```

answers.body_markdown:
Since the `application.yml` is not directly stored in `src/main/resources` it is not loaded.

In your `EntryPoint.java` file, you can add `@PropertySource` annotation and provide the path of your application.yml or you should store the file directly under the resources folder.
answers.title: Spring Boot project can't see data for database connection, written in application.yml

answers.body_markdown:
The application.yml or application.properties file should be in your classpath when the project is build. 
Spring boot has designed its structure such that when a maven build is executed, the property files from src/main/resources are placed into the classes directory  with the other source files. 

Therefore you need to directly place these files in src/main/resources

If you still wish to have the files elsewhere, you can point to the location with `@PropertySource`

answers.body_markdown:
Your code seems to have no problems.

I ran a simplified version of your code (see below), and it worked well in my environment:

    import optuna

    def objective(trial: optuna.Trial):
        # sampling params
        alpha = trial.suggest_uniform('alpha', 0, 100)
        beta = trial.suggest_uniform('beta', 0, 100)

        # evaluating params
        return alpha + beta

    # starting study
    study = optuna.create_study(direction='maximize')
    study.optimize(objective, n_trials=3, n_jobs=1)


Could you tell me about your environment in order to investigate the problem? (e.g., OS, Python version, Python interpreter (CPython, PyPy, IronPython or Jython), Optuna version)


> why the first trial is working.


This error is raised by [optuna/samplers/tpe/sampler.py#558](https://github.com/pfnet/optuna/blob/389a176c8cd1c860001a7a4562670006643e5e11/optuna/samplers/tpe/sampler.py#L558), and this line is only executed when the number of completed trials in the study is greater than zero.

BTW, you might be able to avoid this problem by using `RandomSampler` as follows:

    sampler = optuna.samplers.RandomSampler()
    study = optuna.create_study(direction='maximize', sampler=sampler)

Notice that the optimization performance of `RandomSampler` tends to be worse than `TPESampler` that is the default sampler of Optuna.

answers.body_markdown:
I recreated your case. Whenever we want to pop navigation to the home screen (root) from anywhere, there are couple of ways to do it as below:

1.Using `.isFirst` method:

    Navigator.of(context).popUntil((route) => route.isFirst);

2. Using `defaultRouteName`:

`Navigator.popUntil(context, ModalRoute.withName(Navigator.defaultRouteName));`

By providing the `context` first, the `route` will ensure that the navigation will pop to the default always. 

You can try with either approach. I tested at my end and it works well.

Hope this answers your question.

Committing your code **step by step** is the best way to ensure you can track your work on a daily basis.
Too often you will make changes to your code that will break something and then you will spend hours just coming back to the previous state where it was still working.

Im my company i am encouraged to not push commits to shared repo until im sure they wont make any mess. Then I have two options:

 - Make local commits relating to the changes and then rebase/merge the shared repo with it. This way I make a better use of Git and have more controll over the changes i make with several different commits.
 - Dont make any local commit but just keep all work in dirty workspace. Then i just pull and resolve issues. Finally i can commit al togheter and push. This way i deal better with Eclipse's slow implementation of Git when it comes to merges/rebase between commits.

Any help is appreciated

The port for HTTPS is 443. Most people would solve this by using a reverse proxy, not iptables.

Gitea can handle letsencrypt itself. Here's how:

```
[server]
PROTOCOL=https
DOMAIN=git.example.com
ENABLE_LETSENCRYPT=true
LETSENCRYPT_ACCEPTTOS=true
LETSENCRYPT_DIRECTORY=https
LETSENCRYPT_EMAIL=email@example.com
```

Taken from: https://docs.gitea.io/en-us/https-setup/

answers.body_markdown:
In case someone else need it here is the final configuration file is this, it redirects http requests to https.

I used `# setcap cap_net_bind_service=+ep /path/to/binary/gitea` as ptman suggested.

```
RUN_USER            = git

[server]
PROTOCOL            = https
DOMAIN              = example.com
HTTP_PORT           = 443
REDIRECT_OTHER_PORT = true
CERT_FILE           = /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/fullchain.pem
KEY_FILE            = /etc/letsencrypt/live/example.com/privkey.pem
SSH_DOMAIN          = example.com
DISABLE_SSH         = false
SSH_PORT            = 22
OFFLINE_MODE        = false
```

Looking into [temp.class.spec.match/3](http://eel.is/c++draft/temp.class.spec#match-3), we have

> If the template arguments of a partial specialization cannot be deduced because of the structure of its _template-parameter-list_ and the _template-id_, the program is ill-formed.

with the example

    template <int I, int J> struct A {};
    template <int I> struct A<I+5, I*2> {};     // error
    
    template <int I> struct A<I, I> {};         // OK
    
    template <int I, int J, int K> struct B {};
    template <int I> struct B<I, I*2, 2> {};    // OK

Clang's error message echoes this:

>     error: class template partial specialization contains a template parameter that cannot be deduced; this partial specialization will never be used

(See **@StoryTeller**'s answer for why this deduction fails in your code, I won't duplicate that here.)

answers.body_markdown:
`u` is a logical vector which is used to subset `a`. 

    u
    #[1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE

As 1st element is `FALSE`, we select all `TRUE` elements from `a` by doing `a[u]`

    a[u]
    #[1] "b" "c" "d" "e"

It will be more clear with another example. Consider

    a <- 11:15
    u <- c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)
    a[u]
    #[1] 12 13 15

So all the elements in `a` where `u` is `TRUE` are selected i.e 12, 13 and 15.
answers.title: Subsetting in R (Index Explanation)

answers.body_markdown:
You can figure this out yourself by looking at the contents of the `u` vector:

    u <- a > "a"
    u

    [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE

When you then _subset_ the vector `a` using this boolean vector `u`, you are telling R to output a vector consisting only of elements for which the input index be `TRUE`.  This leaves you with just:

    [1] "b" "c" "d" "e"

To be more explicit:

    "a"  "b"  "c"  "d"  "e"
     F    T    T    T    T
    ^^    |______________|
    drop    keep the rest
answers.title: Subsetting in R (Index Explanation)

answers.body_markdown:
The reason for the warning is that the execution time exceeds the currently set ASP.NET request execution timeout value.

You need to increase the execution time out value.

set below code in your web.config file:

    <system.web>
        <httpRuntime executionTimeout="180" />
    </system.web>


also increase iis site connection time out value.

 - Open your IIS, right-click on your site name.
 - Then open property "Manage Web Site".
 - Then click on "Advanced Settings".
 - Expand the "Limits" section,you can set your "connection
   time out".

[![enter image description here][1]][1]

after doing changes restart the iis server.


  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/8DW1r.png
